subject: Religion & Spirituality
title: Ibn Sina: The Doctor of the Medieval World
description: Learn Ibn Sina: The Doctor of the Medieval World in one minute.

hook.text: His medical textbook was used for 600 years. In the West, they called him Avicenna. He was Islam's greatest physician.

buildup.text: Ibn Sina wrote 'The Canon of Medicine' around 1025 CE. It organized all known medical knowledge systematically.

discovery.text: He described contagion, tested drugs, and mapped anatomy. European universities used his textbook until the 1600s.

twist.text: Ibn Sina was also a philosopher. He reconciled Aristotle with Islam ‚Äî a project that later influenced Thomas Aquinas.

climax.text: A Muslim polymath shaped both Western medicine and Western philosophy. Intellectual borders are human inventions.

punchline.text: Ibn Sina taught Europe medicine for 600 years. Islam healed the West.

quiz.question: Why was Ibn Sina important?
options: His 'Canon of Medicine' was Europe's standard medical text for centuries
